title.rendered: University of Toronto Application 2024 | Acceptance Rate & Requirements

content.rendered:
This is to inform all and sundry that the University of Toronto application portal for admission into the 2024 academic year is currently open. All interested/future students should submit their applications on or before the UoT application deadline.

University of Toronto Ranking

The University of Toronto is widely regarded as one of the top universities in Canada and the world, consistently ranking highly in various global university rankings. Here are some of the recent rankings for the University of Toronto:
  • QS World University Rankings 2022: #25 worldwide
  • Times Higher Education World University Rankings 2022: #18 worldwide
  • Academic Ranking of World Universities 2022: #23 worldwide
  • U.S. News & World Report Best Global Universities Rankings 2022: #18 worldwide

University of toronto Acceptance rate

FAQ Answers

What is the University of Toronto acceptance rate?

 The acceptance rate varies by program and faculty, but the overall acceptance rate for undergraduate programs at the St. George campus was approximately 46% in the 2024 academic year

Is the University of Toronto a highly selective university?

 Yes, the University of Toronto is considered a highly selective university, with many programs and faculties having low acceptance rates.

What factors are considered in the University of Toronto admissions process?

 The University of Toronto considers a range of factors in the admissions process, including academic achievements, extracurricular activities, personal statements, reference letters, and other factors.

Are international students admitted at a lower rate than domestic students?

 The acceptance rate for international students can vary depending on the program and faculty, but in general, international students are not admitted at a lower rate than domestic students.

How can I increase my chances of being admitted to the University of Toronto?

 To increase your chances of being admitted to the University of Toronto, it’s important to have strong academic qualifications, participate in extracurricular activities, submit a compelling personal statement and reference letters, and meet any other requirements for the specific program or faculty you are applying to.

 

University of Toronto Admission Requirement 2024

Admission into the University of Toronto is usually done through the Ontario University Application Centre (OUAC). The U of T admission requirement for the 2024 admission depends on the status of students/applicants. Current Ontario High School students, Non-Ontario students, International students, all have different requirements.

To be considered for admission into the University of Toronto, you must first meet the university requirement.

University of Toronto Application Deadline 2024

All applicants should endeavor to submit an application for admission beginning from October 2024

How to Apply for Admission into the University of Toronto (U of T)

To apply for admission in the U of T, choose your application status below and apply;

Current Ontario High School Students (OUAC 101 Application)

Current Ontario High school students are those students who are current, full time Ontario high school students, expecting to receive Ontario Secondary School Diploma (OSSD) with six Grade 12 U/M courses by the end of the current year.

Apply through Ontario Secondary (High) School Application (Undergrad 101)

 International Applicants (University of Toronto International Application)

International Students/applicants applying to the University of Toronto are those students currently residing outside of Canada, and are not previously studying in Canada, and also not applying to any other Ontario University

Apply International Students

Full-Time Degree Applicants who are NOT current Ontario High School Students (OUAC 105 Application)

These students apply to the University of Toronto when they are NOT currently attending an Ontario high school day program (in Ontario or abroad), AND are NOT current or former U of T students.

Apply Through Ontario University (Undergraduate Application 105)

Full-Time Degree Applicants Previously or Currently Registered as Students at the University of Toronto (University of Toronto Internal Application)

https://www.ouac.on.ca/apply/uoftugrad/internal/en_CA/user/login

Applicants Intending to Study Part-Time (Part-Time Application)

Apply here: https://www.ouac.on.ca/apply/uoftugrad/parttime/en_CA/user/login

Non-Degree Applicants (Non-Degree Application)

Apply here: https://www.ouac.on.ca/apply/uoftugrad/nondegree/en_CA/user/login

Documents required to Complete Application

  • Academic Transcript
  • online ‘self-reported grades’ form,
  • proof of English language proficiency,
  • standardized test results,
  • other supplemental forms

Reasons you may not be admitted to the University of Toronto

The most common reasons for not being admitted to the University of Toronto:

  • Probably your overall average, or grades in prerequisite subjects, are not competitive
  • Maybe you did not present a senior level/Grade 12 English course for admission consideration
  • Maybe you did not present a senior level/Grade 12 course in all prerequisite subjects required for program(s) you applied to
  • Maybe you have repeated an unacceptable number of courses for the program(s) you have selected
  • Maybe you have an insufficient number of available courses at the time of consideration
  • Maybe you applied to a program that does not accept applicants with post-secondary studies
  • Maybe English language requirement (if applicable) was not met by the deadline
  • Maybe supplementary information (if required) was not submitted, or was not competitive
